articles.description: National Rugby League (NRL) squads today returned to work for the first time since the Telstra Premiership was suspended, completing the Apollo Player Protocol workshop, ahead of active training resuming on Wednesday.
articles.content:
National Rugby League (NRL) squads today returned to work for the first time since the Telstra Premiership was suspended, completing the Apollo Player Protocol workshop, ahead of active training resuming on Wednesday.

articles.title: Perry’s perfect reply to Indian cricket star’s ‘beautiful’ remark - Fox Sports
articles.description: Ellyse Perry has issued a cheeky reply after Indian cricket star Murali Vijay said he found the all-rounder “beautiful”.
articles.content:
Perry, who was part of Australias victorious T20 World Cup squad this year but missed the semi-final and final with a hamstring injury, caught Vijays eye.

articles.author: Mitch Cohen
articles.title: Another 3YO sprinter retires to stud - Racenet
articles.description: Group II winner Cosmic Force has become the latest three-year-old to head to the breeding barn after being announced as part of Newgate Farm's stallion roster.
articles.content:
Group II winner Cosmic Force has become the latest three-year-old to head to the breeding barn after being announced as part of Newgate Farm's stallion roster.
The Peter and Paul Snowden-trained colt will stand alongside his sire Deep Field at Newgate for a … [+1393 chars]

articles.author: Shayne Hope
articles.title: Kings import Ware latest star to opt out of NBL deal - Sydney Morning Herald
articles.description: The American was the highest-paid import in the NBL last season after his move from Melbourne United to the Kings.
articles.content:
The NBL confirmed that Ware will now test the market overseas, following dual NBL MVP Bryce Cotton (Perth), Matt Hodgson (Brisbane) and Xavier Cooks (Sydney) in pulling the pin in recent days.
Players have a deadline of May 4 to decide whether to exit their … [+1468 chars]

articles.title: Nations Cup back on agenda: Beaumont - Rugby.com.au
articles.description: World Rugby chairman Bill Beaumont has revived the Nations Cup concept, saying that it could be played in consecutive windows.
articles.content:
World Rugby chairman Bill Beaumont has revived the Nations Cup concept, saying that it could be played in consecutive windows.
Beaumont, who was elected for a second four-year term last week, said while plans were still in the "embryo" stages, there was argu… [+2448 chars]

articles.title: How MJ villain’s USA snub led to greatest basketball game never seen - Fox Sports
articles.description: The debate over the 1992 Dream Team, who won Olympic gold in Barcelona, has been reignited thanks to ‘The Last Dance’.
articles.content:
For the most part, the discussion has centred around Isiah Thomas absence, and the reason for it.
